summary: This document is an email chain from September 2019 discussing coordination between a U.S. Department of Justice attaché in Paris and U.S. prosecutors in the Southern District of New York regarding a request from the Paris prosecutor's office for information on Jeffrey Epstein's potential connections to France. The emails focus on setting up calls to discuss the mechanics and confidentiality of sharing investigative information.

persons.name: DOJ Attaché/Magistrat de liaison américain
persons.role: DOJ Attaché/Liaison Magistrate at U.S. Embassy, Paris
persons.context: The sender/recipient of emails coordinating with SDNY prosecutors about sharing information on Epstein with French authorities. They received an inquiry from the Paris prosecutor's office.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: A prosecutor on the SDNY team handling the investigation into Epstein and his co-conspirators. They offer to discuss the French inquiry.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The target of the SDNY investigation. The French inquiry concerns his potential connections to France.

connections.description: Coordinating on how to respond to a French legal request for information regarding the Epstein investigation.
Described as the SDNY team handling the investigation into Epstein and his co-conspirators.
The attaché received an inquiry from and is scheduled to have a call with the Paris prosecutor's office regarding information sharing.

events.title: Call Scheduled with Paris Prosecutor
events.description: The DOJ attaché in Paris schedules a call with the Paris prosecutor's office to discuss the confidentiality of information that could be shared regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Email Coordination on French Inquiry
events.description: Emails are exchanged between a DOJ attaché in Paris and SDNY prosecutors to connect regarding an inquiry from the Paris prosecutor's office about Epstein's potential connections to France.

locations: 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: In September 2019, French authorities (Paris prosecutor's office) made an inquiry to the U.S. regarding Jeffrey Epstein's potential connections to France.
A U.S. Department of Justice attaché in Paris acted as a liaison, coordinating with prosecutors from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) who were handling the Epstein investigation.
The primary discussion point was determining the mechanics and level of confidentiality under which information from the U.S. investigation could be shared with French authorities.
The document shows active international coordination in the Epstein investigation shortly after his arrest and death.
